Replace.Text: Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time. Military units currently located in the territory of this city have +1 [ICON_Movement] movement.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the enemy military units currently located in the territory of this city have -1 [ICON_Movement] movement power.
Emperor Keke: The Bullet of Three
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time. Military units currently located in the territory of this city will gain additional combat experience points.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time. Military units currently located in the territory of this city can be healed every round.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the military units currently located within the territory of this city have +1 vision.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the enemy military units currently located in the territory of this city have -1 vision.
Emperor Keke: The Bullet of Seven
Tokisaki Kurumi's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time], and other players' current military units' [ICON_Movement] mobility will be greatly reduced for three rounds.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time to obtain a Nightmare Shadow without consuming [ICON_Citizen] population.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time to gain temporary vision of all cities and city-states.

Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time to increase the visibility level of the object with the lowest diplomatic visibility [ICON_VisLimited] by one level. [COLOR_Civ6Red] If diplomatic visibility reaches maximum for all civilizations, [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] consumed will be refunded[ENDCOLOR].
Emperor Keke: The Bullet of Eleven

Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time. Your empire gains [ICON_Science] scientific value, [ICON_Culture] cultural value, [ICON_Gold] gold coins and [ICON_Faith] faith that are proportional to the city's productivity.

Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time]. Other empires lose the [ICON_Science] science value, [ICON_Culture] culture value, [ICON_Gold] gold coin and [ICON_Faith] faith produced in three rounds.
Gain additional [ICON_Strength] combat power from Nightmare Camp and adjacent Nightmare Shadows.
+1[ICON_Movement] movement. Ignores the [ICON_Movement] movement cost of terrain and landforms.
Adjacent enemy units have -1[ICON_Movement] movement. This unit can only be discovered by adjacent enemy units.
100% efficiency when attacking cities and camps from a distance. When a unit is killed in combat, all adjacent enemy combat units lose [ICON_Damaged] health.

When a unit is destroyed, additional [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time is gained. When attacking a city, there is a certain chance that it will lose its population and gain [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time].
When attacking a wounded unit, +5[ICON_Strength] combat strength. When a unit is destroyed, it can heal up to 30 health points.
Block the first non-lethal damage taken each round.
If [ICON_Movement] mobility allows, +1 additional attack per round. When you kill a unit in combat, there is a chance to restore [ICON_Movement] movement and attack times.

Tokisaki Kurumi's special project consumes one [ICON_Citizen] population in exchange for [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the city's [ICON_Loyalty] loyalty is slightly reduced. [NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]If there is only one [ICON_Citizen] left in the city, it will become a free city. [ENDCOLOR]

Halloween Madness III's special building replaces the workshop. [NEWLINE]After researching "Electricity" technology, this building can provide an additional +2 [ICON_Culture] cultural value for the city where it is located. [NEWLINE] Its [ICON_Production] productivity bonus extends to all city centers within 3 tiles that do not receive bonuses from this building type. [NEWLINE]If there is a chief executive in this city, you will get a [ICON_RESOURCE_DAL_POTION] potion, a specially produced luxury resource that can +6 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction. [NEWLINE]This city gets the [ICON_Production] productivity bonus from all nearby industrial buildings with area bonuses, not just the first one.

The unique improved facilities of Warrior Crazy Three are +1 [ICON_Culture] cultural value. After developing drama and poetry, an additional +1 [ICON_Culture] cultural value will be added. Provides [ICON_tourism] tourism performance after R&D flight. -2[ICON_Appeal] Charm. Each city can only have one dungeon, which cannot be built next to another dungeon. It can be built on plains or hilly cells without landforms. [NEWLINE]Occupied units gain +4 [ICON_Strength] defense. Adjacent non-friendly units have -1 [ICON_Movement] movement power. When stepping into them, there is a high chance of receiving damage and a low chance of gaining experience points.
